model.levelsequence.level

Interface Level

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LevelImpl

    public interface Level
extends java.io.Serializable
    A Level of the game, which has a name and a validated Grid.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Two levels are equals if they have equal name and equal grid.
      Grid getCurrentGrid()
      Gets the grid in its current state.

      Gets the grid in its initial state.

      Gets the name.
      Element getUser()
      Gets the user Element.
      int hashCode()
      The hash code of a level is computed on its name and grid.
      boolean isFinished()
      Checks if the level is finished, i.e.
      void validate()
      Validates the level.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name.
        Returns:
        the name

        Grid getInitialGrid()
        Gets the grid in its initial state.

        Element getUser()
        Gets the user Element.
        Returns:

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Checks if the level is finished, i.e. all the boxes are on a target.
        Returns:
        true, if finished

      • validate

        void validate()
       throws LevelNotValidException
        Validates the level. It checks that the level has exactly one user, at least one target and an equal number of targets and boxes. If not correct, it throws a LevelNotValidException.
        Throws:
        LevelNotValidException - if level is not correct

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        The hash code of a level is computed on its name and grid.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the computed hash code

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Two levels are equals if they have equal name and equal grid.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to be compared
        Returns:
        true, if successful
